page.title: 10 Adstock Fields Farm
page.content: Owned by Mrs Nicholson, the farm estate includes Hanover farm and land at Addington. Two dairy herds are kept, oats, wheat and barley are grown and beef cattle are reared. Pigs are kept in fox covert where pheasants are reared. Fox hunting takes place in winter. 1 fox to 1000 acres is reckoned to be enough. Glebe lands of Padbury and Adstock are reuted,together with the larger one at Addington.Glebelaids were once part of the stipend of the vicar,who also collocted tithes from his parishoners. The magnificent title the barn still stands at Addington. Untill about 6 years ago the rent for Addington glebe was paid to the vicar of Winslow,but now goes directly to the board of finance of the church of England.
